author: fradamt
content: I think this is a somewhat unfair complaint in this case. IL research has been public since all the way back in 2021, with most meaningful research outputs being immediately put on ethresearch for discussion. Someone wishing to follow the conversation can almost pick any ethresearch post and find the linked material there. There doesn't need to be a discord channel for people to be informed and/or participate, nor does there need to be (imho) a public history of all discussions, as long as design decisions are sufficiently documented in what is published (which I believe to be the case here)

author: fradamt
content: The full IL has to be returned to the relay together with the SignedBlindedBeaconBlock, or at least gossiped in advance. Either way, the relay *has to* have a valid IL before releasing the block, or it just cannot guarantee that releasing the block will lead to it becoming canonical

author: fradamt
content:
If we want to preserve the fact that the mev-boost commitment from the proposer can only be reneged through a slashable fault, we should couple IL and beacon block as p2p objects, otherwise this attack is possible:
- proposer correctly returns a valid signed blinded beacon block and a valid matching IL to the relay, which gossips both
- meanwhile, the proposer has separately gossiped a different *invalid* IL. Most validators see that first (since they don't check validity for propagation) and don't accept/forward the valid IL gossiped by the relay. Once their EL fails to validate it, they conclude there's no valid IL and do not vote for the block. 

It does not lead to same-slot unbundling, and it's not an attack that makes much sense for the proposer tbh, but still worse than the status quo, where to do this you actually have to do block equivocation and get slashed

author: fradamt
content:
I don't find it strictly better to force people to work in a noisy discord channel, particularly at research stages where only a few people are actively involved. Should we be recording and publishing every call with 2 people too? 
As far as ILs specifically, there has never been even a telegram channel for it for the longest time, just sporadic work done mostly by individuals. There has been a telegram channel for the EIP just as of October, which maybe could have been a discord channel since the beginning (even then, Mike has published multiple updates and talked about them on ACD, and we have had a breakout call for it). Other than that, I don't think there is any ground to claim that IL research has been done in secret. People that wish to participate should not be required to read years of message history, but they should be expected to read a few ethresearch posts or other relevant resources that are easily available, and I don't see anything wrong with that

author: fradamt
content: Of all the things you can claim about the Ethereum research ecosystem, saying that research is not done in public seems quite the reach tbh

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
I am aware that this was proposed way earlier, 
I just think that none of the drawbacks outweigh the benefits (no hard fork necessary, easy to implement, builders can opt-out, censoring builders will loose market-share, no benefit of multiple proposals in a row, no free data availability)

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
I just don't see the benefit of EIP-7547 over a simple design since:
- Validators can opt out of the scheme (by not including ILs)
- Block-producers/Relays can opt out of it  (by not bidding on blocks, which will result in the rational choice for validators to not use it)
- Producers that produce multiple blocks in a row can include high-paying or valuable transactions in the IL and low paying transactions for the next producer
- The EIP requires extensive changes to the EL and CL consensus and P2P
- The transactions are "tagged on" which means they do not act to the gas limit, which allows validators that control the list to reap outsized rewards

Essentially from my point of view we're adding a bunch of new mechanisms that might or might not work, since the equillibrium is to just not use the mechanism, but the mechanism itself requires significant changes to both EL and CL

author: sky.cactus
content: Block producers/relays can opt-out, but the people they are engaged with aren't the ones who generate the IL so their opting out doesn't apply pressure to those producers who use it.

author: sky.cactus
